description.narrative: The Project will provide financing to Enclave Power Company Limited (EPCL or the Company) to increase the attractiveness of the Tema Free Zones Enclave (Tema FZ) and Dawa Industrial Zone (Dawa IZ) by building (i) a 16.8 MWp capacity roof-top solar installation in Tema FZ (the Solar Plant), and (ii) the first phase of a water treatment plant in Dawa (the Water Plant) (together the Project). The Solar Plant and Water Plant will be implemented by Helios Solar Company Limited (HSC) and Southern Water Company Limited (SWC), respectively. EPCL is a private power distribution company and a subsidiary of LMI Holdings. It is responsible for distributing about 51.31 MW (Peak Average for 2021) of power purchased from the Volta River Authority to over 80 multinational and local manufacturing companies.

The Project will improve the affordability of electricity supply in Tema FZ and Dawa IZ, improve the quality of water supply to the Dawa IZ, and reduce the associated CO2 emissions. The Project involves the construction of a 16.8 MWp rooftop solar installation that contributes to improving competitiveness of the industrial zones. It also adds a 4,000 m3/day water treatment plant, which will serve new tenants in the Dawa IZ with reliable potable water.

  At a market level, the Project will demonstrate the potential of on-site solar generation as a cost effective, reliable, and green alternative to thermal power from the grid. This investment will be the first private sector-led utility scale solar project developed by a Ghanaian company that can be replicated by other high-volume customers. The water facility also constitutes the first investment in Ghana to develop, build and operate a private-to-industries water treatment plant that can be replicated by similar large-scale facilities not adequately served by the water distribution network.
